verses.verse: Elihu <S%H453><s%> also proceeded <S%H3254><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>,
Suffer <S%H3803><s%> me a little <S%H2191><s%>, and I will show <S%H2331><s%> thee <S%H4405><s%>; For I have yet somewhat to say on God <S%H433><s%>'s behalf.
I will fetch <S%H5375><s%> my knowledge <S%H1843><s%> from afar <S%H7350><s%>, And will ascribe <S%H5414><s%> righteousness <S%H6664><s%> to my Maker <S%H6466><s%>.
For truly <S%H551><s%> my words <S%H4405><s%> are not false <S%H8267><s%>: One that is perfect <S%H8549><s%> in knowledge is with thee <S%H1844><s%>.
Behold <S%H410><s%>, God is mighty <S%H3524><s%>, and despiseth <S%H3988><s%> not any <S%H3524><s%>: He is mighty in strength <S%H3581><s%> of understanding <S%H3820><s%>.
He preserveth not the life <S%H2421><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%>, But giveth <S%H5414><s%> to the afflicted <S%H6041><s%> their right <S%H4941><s%>.

He withdraweth <S%H1639><s%> not his eyes <S%H5869><s%> from the righteous <S%H6662><s%>: But with kings <S%H4428><s%> upon the throne <S%H3678><s%> He setteth <S%H3427><s%> them for ever <S%H5331><s%>, and they are exalted <S%H1361><s%>.
And if they be bound <S%H631><s%> in fetters <S%H2131><s%>, And be taken <S%H3920><s%> in the cords <S%H2256><s%> of afflictions <S%H6040><s%>;
Then he showeth <S%H5046><s%> them their work <S%H6467><s%>, And their transgressions <S%H6588><s%>, that they have behaved themselves proudly <S%H1396><s%>.
He openeth <S%H1540><s%> also their ear <S%H241><s%> to instruction <S%H4148><s%>, And commandeth <S%H559><s%> that they return <S%H7725><s%> from iniquity <S%H205><s%>.

If they hearken <S%H8085><s%> and serve <S%H5647><s%> him <S%H3615><s%>, They shall spend their days <S%H3117><s%> in prosperity <S%H2896><s%>, And their years <S%H8141><s%> in pleasures <S%H5273><s%>.
But if they hearken <S%H8085><s%> not <S%H5674><s%>, they shall perish by the sword <S%H7973><s%>, And they shall die <S%H1478><s%> without knowledge <S%H1847><s%>.
But they that are godless <S%H2611><s%> in heart <S%H3820><s%> lay up <S%H7760><s%> anger <S%H639><s%>: They cry <S%H7768><s%> not for help when he bindeth them <S%H631><s%>.
They <S%H5315><s%> die <S%H4191><s%> in youth <S%H5290><s%>, And their life <S%H2416><s%> perisheth among the unclean <S%H6945><s%>.
He delivereth <S%H2502><s%> the afflicted <S%H6041><s%> by their affliction <S%H6040><s%>, And openeth <S%H1540><s%> their ear <S%H241><s%> in oppression <S%H3906><s%>.

Yea <S%H5496><s%>, he would have allured thee out of distress <S%H6310><s%> Into a broad place <S%H7338><s%>, where <S%H8478><s%> there is no straitness <S%H4164><s%>; And that which is set <S%H5183><s%> on thy table <S%H7979><s%> would be full <S%H4390><s%> of fatness <S%H1880><s%>.
But thou art full <S%H4390><s%> of the judgment <S%H1779><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%>: Judgment <S%H1779><s%> and justice <S%H1779><s%> take hold on thee <S%H8551><s%>.
For let not wrath <S%H2534><s%> stir thee up against <S%H5496><s%> chastisements <S%H5607><s%>; Neither let the greatness <S%H7230><s%> of the ransom <S%H3724><s%> turn thee aside <S%H5186><s%>.
Will thy cry <S%H7769><s%> avail <S%H6186><s%>, that thou be not in distress <S%H1222><s%>, Or all the forces <S%H3981><s%> of thy strength <S%H3581><s%>?
Desire <S%H7602><s%> not the night <S%H3915><s%>, When peoples <S%H5971><s%> are cut off in their place <S%H5927><s%>.
Take heed <S%H8104><s%>, regard <S%H6437><s%> not iniquity <S%H205><s%>: For this hast thou chosen <S%H977><s%> rather than affliction <S%H6040><s%>.
Behold <S%H410><s%>, God doeth loftily <S%H7682><s%> in his power <S%H3581><s%>: Who is a teacher like unto him <S%H3384><s%>?
Who hath enjoined <S%H6485><s%> him his way <S%H1870><s%>? Or who can say <S%H559><s%>, Thou hast wrought <S%H6466><s%> unrighteousness <S%H5766><s%>?
Remember <S%H2142><s%> that thou magnify <S%H7679><s%> his work <S%H6467><s%>, Whereof men <S%H582><s%> have sung <S%H7891><s%>.
All men <S%H120><s%> have looked <S%H2372><s%> thereon <S%H582><s%>; Man beholdeth <S%H5027><s%> it afar off <S%H7350><s%>.
Behold <S%H410><s%>, God is great <S%H7689><s%>, and we know <S%H3045><s%> him not <S%H4557><s%>; The number of his years <S%H8141><s%> is unsearchable <S%H2714><s%>.
For he draweth up <S%H1639><s%> the drops <S%H5198><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%>, Which distil <S%H2212><s%> in rain <S%H4306><s%> from his vapor <S%H108><s%>,
Which the skies <S%H7834><s%> pour down <S%H7491><s%> And drop <S%H5140><s%> upon man <S%H120><s%> abundantly <S%H7227><s%>.
Yea <S%H995><s%>, can any understand the spreadings <S%H4666><s%> of the clouds <S%H5645><s%>, The thunderings <S%H8663><s%> of his pavilion <S%H5521><s%>?
Behold <S%H6566><s%>, he spreadeth his light <S%H216><s%> around him <S%H3680><s%>; And he covereth the bottom <S%H8328><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%>.
For by these he judgeth <S%H1777><s%> the peoples <S%H5971><s%>; He giveth <S%H5414><s%> food <S%H400><s%> in abundance <S%H4342><s%>.
He covereth <S%H3680><s%> his hands <S%H3709><s%> with the lightning <S%H216><s%>, And giveth it a charge <S%H6680><s%> that it strike the mark <S%H6293><s%>.
The noise <S%H7452><s%> thereof telleth <S%H5046><s%> concerning him <S%H4735><s%>, The cattle also concerning the storm that cometh up <S%H5927><s%>.
